en: Even if he is busy, he will come.
zh: 即使他很忙，他也会来的。

en: I will be friendly to him even if he doesn't like me.
zh: 即使他不喜欢我，我也会对他友好的。

en: Don't trust him, whatever he says.
zh: 别相信他，无论他说什么。

en: No matter what he says, I'll never believe him again.
zh: 无论他说什么，我都不会再相信他了。

en: She believes him, whatever he says.
zh: 无论他说什么，她都相信他。

en: Let him be a great statesman, I don't admire him.
zh: 就算他是个伟大的政治家，我也不仰慕他。

en: Even if he doesn't come here, I'll go on waiting for him.
zh: 即使他不来这里，我也会继续等他。

en: I have to go even if it rains cats and dogs.
zh: 即使下倾盆大雨，我也必须去。

en: Even if pigs were to fly in the air, I would believe her.
zh: 就算猪在天上飞，我也会相信她。

en: I will go, be the weather what it may.
zh: 无论天气如何，我都会去。

en: Whomever you may ask, you can't get a satisfactory answer.
zh: 无论你问谁，你都得不到满意的答案。

en: Whoever telephones, tell him I'm out.
zh: 无论谁打电话来，都告诉他我出去了。

en: No matter who says so, I don't believe it.
zh: 无论谁这么说，我都不相信。

en: Whoever may say so, I don't believe it.
zh: 无论谁这么说，我都不相信。

en: Even if there is a convention, I shouldn't ask them for so much money.
zh: 即使要开会，我也不应该向他们要这么多钱。

en: I will go even if it should rain heavily.
zh: 即使下大雨，我也会去。

en: Even if the sun were to rise in the west, I would not change my mind.
zh: 即使太阳从西边出来，我也不会改变主意。

en: If the sun were to rise in the west, I would never agree to your plan.
zh: 如果太阳从西边出来，我也绝不会同意你的计划。

en: If the sun were to rise in the west, I would not break my word.
zh: 如果太阳从西边出来，我也不会食言。

en: I always buy a top quality product even if it is slightly more expensive.
zh: 即使稍微贵一点，我也总是买质量最好的产品。

en: I have a watch that is nice, if not new.
zh: 我有一块表，即使不是新的，也很好。

en: A watered down compromise resolution is better than none at all.
zh: 一个被淡化的妥协决议也比没有好。

en: If he fails, so what?
zh: 如果他失败了，那又怎样？

en: Even if you have your own way, you will not always be successful.
zh: 即使你随心所欲，你也不会总是成功的。

en: If not confidently, at least hopefully.
zh: 即使不是充满信心，至少充满希望。

en: If I am dull, I am at least industrious.
zh: 即使我很笨，至少我很勤奋。

en: Even if we do this, it will be another sixty years before the Antarctic ozone hole is repaired.
zh: 即使我们这样做，南极臭氧空洞也还需要六十年才能修复。

en: Even though I was right, he got the best of me.
zh: 即使我是对的，他还是占了上风。

en: Even if I am wrong, you are not quite right.
zh: 即使我是错的，你也不完全对。

en: Even if he is in trouble, Mac is always optimistic.
zh: 即使他遇到麻烦，麦克总是很乐观。

en: You have another chance even if you fail this time.
zh: 即使你这次失败了，你还有另一次机会。

en: All people can become friends, even if their languages and customs are different.
zh: 所有人都可以成为朋友，即使他们的语言和习俗不同。

en: Even if you make great efforts, you won't be able to achieve it.
zh: 即使你付出巨大的努力，你也无法实现它。

en: Granting you were drunk, I cannot excuse you.
zh: 就算你喝醉了，我也不能原谅你。

en: Even if you stop me, I won't change my mind.
zh: 即使你阻止我，我也不会改变主意。

en: Whatever you may say, I will not change my opinion.
zh: 无论你说什么，我都不会改变我的看法。

en: Even if you don't like music, you'll enjoy his concert.
zh: 即使你不喜欢音乐，你也会喜欢他的音乐会。

en: He didn't like to ask for help even if he was starving.
zh: 即使他饿了，他也不喜欢寻求帮助。

en: Even though he is learned, I can't respect him.
zh: 即使他很有学问，我也无法尊重他。

en: No matter how cold it is outside, the rooms are comfortably heated.
zh: 无论外面有多冷，房间里都暖和舒适。

en: I'll follow you, come hell or high water.
zh: 无论如何我都会跟随你。

en: Go through fire and water.
zh: 赴汤蹈火。

en: Even if I have to sell my house, I'll keep my business going.
zh: 即使我必须卖掉我的房子，我也会维持我的生意。

en: Live where she may, she always enjoys her surroundings.
zh: 无论她住在哪里，她总是享受周围的环境。

en: No matter what you may do, you must do your best.
zh: 无论你做什么，你都必须尽力而为。

en: Even when she thought about something else, ideas of death returned to her mind.
zh: 即使当她想到别的事情时，死亡的念头也会回到她的脑海中。

en: Whatever happens, you must keep calm.
zh: 无论发生什么，你都必须保持冷静。

en: No matter what may happen, I am always prepared for it.
zh: 无论发生什么事，我总是做好准备。

en: Don't change your plans, whatever happens.
zh: 无论发生什么事，都不要改变你的计划。

en: No matter what happens, you must be here by nine.
zh: 无论发生什么事，你都必须在九点之前到这里。

en: No matter what happens, I am prepared.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都准备好了。

en: I will go cycling even if it rains.
zh: 即使下雨，我也会去骑自行车。

en: Even though it is raining, he will play golf.
zh: 即使下着雨，他也要去打高尔夫球。

en: Even if it should rain, I will start tomorrow.
zh: 就算下雨，我明天也会开始。

en: I will go there even if it rains.
zh: 即使下雨，我也会去那里。

en: I have to go even if it rains.
zh: 即使下雨，我也必须去。

en: Even if it rains, I will start early tomorrow morning.
zh: 即使下雨，我明天早上也会早点开始。

en: Even if it rains, the game will be played.
zh: 即使下雨，比赛也会进行。

en: Even if it rains, I'll start.
zh: 即使下雨，我也会开始。

en: The game will be played even if it rains.
zh: 即使下雨，比赛也会进行。

en: The soccer game will be played, even if it rains.
zh: 即使下雨，足球比赛也会进行。

en: Even though it is raining, I don't care at all.
zh: 即使下着雨，我也一点都不在意。

en: Even if it rains, I'll go swimming tomorrow.
zh: 即使下雨，我明天也要去游泳。

en: Even if you are not to blame, you should apologize.
zh: 即使你没有错，你也应该道歉。

en: Such poets as Toson and Hakushu are rare.
zh: 像杜聪和白秋这样的诗人很少见。

en: Ball games, such as basketball and ping-pong, are usually played indoors.
zh: 球类运动，例如篮球和乒乓球，通常在室内进行。

en: For instance, bowing is peculiar to us, the Japanese.
zh: 例如，鞠躬是我们日本人特有的。

en: Take, for instance, your family problems.
zh: 例如，拿你的家庭问题来说。

en: How many samples, for example?
zh: 例如，需要多少样本？

en: For example, he speaks German, French and English.
zh: 例如，他会说德语、法语和英语。

en: For example, Koko was asked to choose a house or a tree for shelter from the rain.
zh: 例如，可可被要求选择房子或树来躲避雨。

en: For example, they do not have to go to a stadium to see the World Series or the Super Bowl because they can enjoy watching the games in their own living rooms.
zh: 例如，他们不必去体育场观看世界大赛或超级碗，因为他们可以在自己的客厅里享受观看比赛的乐趣。

en: Whatever story I tell, Mother believes me.
zh: 无论我说什么故事，妈妈都相信我。

en: No weather was severe enough to keep him indoors.
zh: 任何恶劣的天气都无法阻止他出门。

en: She paints every day no matter how busy she is.
zh: 无论她多忙，她每天都画画。

en: No matter how long it takes, I will finish the job.
zh: 无论花多久时间，我都会完成这项工作。

en: However hard you may study, you can't master English in a year or so.
zh: 无论你多么努力学习，你也不可能在一年左右的时间内掌握英语。

en: Try as you may, you can't do it in a day.
zh: 无论你怎么尝试，你都不能在一天之内完成它。

en: No amount of money can buy happiness.
zh: 再多的钱也买不到幸福。

en: No matter what happens, I won't change my mind.
zh: 无论发生什么，我都不会改变主意。

en: Whichever you choose, you cannot lose.
zh: 无论你选择哪个，你都不会吃亏。

en: Whichever bus you may take, you can get to the station.
zh: 无论你乘坐哪辆公交车，你都能到达车站。

en: Wherever you may go, you can't succeed without perseverance.
zh: 无论你去哪里，没有毅力你都无法成功。

en: Go where you will, you can't hope for success without effort.
zh: 无论你去哪里，不努力你就别想成功。

en: No matter where you live, you would find it difficult not to laugh at, say, Charlie Chaplin's early films.
zh: 无论你住在哪里，你都会觉得很难不笑，比如说，卓别林早期的电影。

en: There are few, if any, such men.
zh: 即使有，也寥寥无几。

en: Even if it is true, it matters little.
zh: 即使那是真的，也无关紧要。

en: Even if you do not like it, you must take charge of it.
zh: 即使你不喜欢它，你也必须负责。

en: Even if the performance is good, I still say we drop the project.
zh: 即使表演很好，我仍然认为我们应该放弃这个项目。

en: You must do it even if you don't want to.
zh: 即使你不想做，你也必须做。

en: Even though you don't like this, you must eat it.
zh: 即使你不喜欢这个，你也必须吃掉它。

en: Even if I were rich, I wouldn't give money to him.
zh: 即使我很有钱，我也不会给他钱。

en: You must do the work, even if you do not like it.
zh: 即使你不喜欢，你也必须做这项工作。

en: Whenever you visit him, you will find him playing video games.
zh: 无论你什么时候拜访他，你都会发现他在玩电子游戏。

en: The millionaire insisted on acquiring the masterpiece no matter how much it cost.
zh: 无论花费多少，这位百万富翁都坚持要获得这件杰作。

en: Even if you go far away, let's keep in touch with each other over the phone.
zh: 即使你走得很远，我们也要通过电话保持联系。

en: No matter where you go, I'll follow you.
zh: 无论你去哪里，我都会跟着你。

en: Even if it takes you three years, you must accomplish your goal.
zh: 即使要花你三年时间，你也必须完成你的目标。

en: Even if it costs 10,000 yen, I must buy the dictionary.
zh: 即使要花一万日元，我也必须买这本词典。

en: Even if it takes me ten years, I am determined to accomplish the job.
zh: 即使要花我十年时间，我也决心完成这项工作。

en: Were the sun to rise in the west, she would not change her resolution.
zh: 即使太阳从西边升起，她也不会改变她的决心。

en: Even if you boss attacks you and tells you to go away, you should make your point.
zh: 即使你老板攻击你，让你走开，你也应该表明你的观点。

en: I want to get the word out - even if you don't have a lot of clothes you can enjoy dressing more fashionably by mixing and matching.
zh: 我想把话说清楚——即使你没有很多衣服，你也可以通过混搭来享受更时尚的穿着。

en: There is no accounting for tastes.
zh: 人各有所好。

en: Tatsuya has some friends who live in New York.
zh: 达也有些朋友住在纽约。

en: Because we'll all fall down on the cold ground.
zh: 因为我们都会倒在冰冷的地上。

en: Because you're a sweet and lovely girl.
zh: 因为你是一个甜美可爱的女孩。

en: They live there.
zh: 他们住在那里。

en: The lights went out just now.
zh: 刚才灯灭了。

en: I heard a shot just now.
zh: 我刚才听到一声枪响。

en: I've just finished my work.
zh: 我刚刚完成我的工作。

en: I want you to take back what you said just now.
zh: 我希望你收回你刚才说的话。

en: A fishing boat put off just now.
zh: 刚才有一艘渔船出发了。

en: I've just come back.
zh: 我刚回来。

en: It began raining just now.
zh: 刚才开始下雨了。

en: I only just saw the accident.
zh: 我刚刚才看到那场事故。

en: I was just mugged.
zh: 我刚才被抢劫了。

en: Only one little daughter did they have.
zh: 他们只有一个小女儿。

en: Not a single word did he say.
zh: 他一句话也没说。

en: A mere 529 spectators watched the game.
zh: 只有区区529名观众观看了比赛。

en: No more than 50 people came.
zh: 只来了不超过50人。

en: They're only $50 with two cans of shoe polish free of charge.
zh: 它们只要50美元，还免费赠送两罐鞋油。

en: It took little more than an hour.
zh: 只花了一个多小时。

en: You just messed up once. You don't need to agonize over it.
zh: 你只是犯了一次错。你不需要为此苦恼。

en: It only costs $10.00!
zh: 只要10美元！

en: Could you tell me the way to Madame Tussaud's?
zh: 请问去杜莎夫人蜡像馆怎么走？

en: A dachshund is a dog from Germany with a very long body and short legs.
zh: 腊肠犬是一种来自德国的狗，它的身体很长，腿很短。

en: Dachshund sausages first became popular in New York, especially at baseball games.
zh: 腊肠犬香肠最初在纽约流行起来，尤其是在棒球比赛中。

en: An ostrich does not fly through the air.
zh: 鸵鸟不会在空中飞行。

en: Ostriches are incapable of flight.
zh: 鸵鸟不具备飞行能力。

en: The ostrich has wings, but it cannot fly.
zh: 鸵鸟有翅膀，但它不能飞。

en: An ostrich can not fly any more than a kangaroo can.
zh: 鸵鸟不能飞，就像袋鼠不能飞一样。

en: The panic spread through the district in an instant.
zh: 恐慌瞬间蔓延到整个地区。

en: I could see nothing but fog.
zh: 我什么也看不见，只有雾。

en: Just keep on walking.
zh: 继续走就是了。

en: You should never look down on a person merely because he is poor.
zh: 你永远不应该仅仅因为一个人贫穷就看不起他。

en: You have only to believe him.
zh: 你只需要相信他。

en: Just imitate what he does.
zh: 照他做的模仿就行了。

en: You can just call me Taro.
zh: 你可以直接叫我太郎。

en: All you have to do is to cultivate the ability to put yourself in the other fellow's place.
zh: 你所要做的就是培养设身处地为他人着想的能力。

en: Some read books just to pass time.
zh: 有些人读书只是为了打发时间。

en: She left me simply because I had a small income.
zh: 她离开我仅仅是因为我的收入很低。

en: We have a visitor right now. Would you mind waiting for a while?
zh: 我们现在有客人。 你介意等一会儿吗？

en: We are currently experiencing some turbulence.
zh: 我们目前正在经历一些颠簸。

en: We are full just now.
zh: 我们现在客满了。

en: They are merely different.
zh: 它们仅仅是不同的。

en: Fine words butter no parsnips.
zh: 花言巧语不能当饭吃。

en: Merely to breathe does not mean to live.
zh: 仅仅是呼吸并不意味着活着。

en: He could do nothing but watch.
zh: 他只能眼睁睁地看着。

en: We can but wait for the results.
zh: 我们只能等待结果。

en: He is just pulling your leg.
zh: 他只是在跟你开玩笑。

en: One can no more write good English than one can compose good music, merely by keeping the rules.
zh: 正如仅仅遵守规则无法创作出好的音乐一样，人们也无法仅仅通过遵守规则写出好的英语。

en: You've just been down in the dumps.
zh: 你只是情绪低落而已。

en: Only one careless mistake cost the company millions of dollars.
zh: 仅仅一个粗心的错误就让公司损失了数百万美元。

en: I was waiting all alone.
zh: 我独自一人在等待。

en: My sole idea was to get there as fast as possible.
zh: 我唯一的想法就是尽快到达那里。

en: The only way was to ask her for help.
zh: 唯一的办法就是请求她的帮助。

en: The only solution is for her to give up the plan.
zh: 唯一的解决办法是她放弃这个计划。

en: You never get something for nothing.
zh: 天下没有免费的午餐。

en: You can't get anything for nothing.
zh: 你不可能不劳而获。

en: One mistake will cost a person his life.
zh: 一个错误会让人丧命。

en: You probably just have a cold.
zh: 你可能只是感冒了。

en: It's just a trick of the wind.
zh: 这只是风在作怪。

en: How about giving me a promotion from just-a-friend to boyfriend?
zh: 要不要考虑把我从普通朋友升职为男朋友？

en: I would hate to become just a housewife.
zh: 我不想仅仅成为一个家庭主妇。

en: Not a word did he speak.
zh: 他一句话也没说。

en: You may have it for nothing.
zh: 你可以免费得到它。

en: It was bad enough that he usually came to work late, but coming in drunk was the last straw, and I'm going to have to let him go.
zh: 他上班经常迟到已经够糟糕了，竟然还喝醉了来，真是压垮骆驼的最后一根稻草，我不得不解雇他了。

en: You can have this book for nothing.
zh: 你可以免费拿走这本书。

en: I just felt like hearing the sound of your voice.
zh: 我只是想听听你的声音。

en: We must act at once.
zh: 我们必须立刻行动。

en: I want you to go to Osaka at once.
zh: 我希望你立刻去大阪。

en: We must carry out the plan at once.
zh: 我们必须立刻执行这个计划。

en: He just drones on and on but hardly even touches on what we need to know for the test.
zh: 他只是喋喋不休地说个没完，但几乎没有提到我们需要知道的考试内容。

en: If it does not rain.
zh: 如果不下雨的话。

en: However, you have to queue...
zh: 但是，你得排队...

en: All that I was looking for was somebody who looked like you.
zh: 我一直在寻找一个长得像你的人。

en: He lost his position just because he refused to tell a lie.
zh: 他丢掉职位仅仅是因为他拒绝说谎。

en: The line is busy now. Please hold the line.
zh: 现在线路正忙。请稍等。

en: The line is busy now.
zh: 现在线路正忙。

en: He's gone to Nagoya on business.
zh: 他去名古屋出差了。

en: We're out of stock now.
zh: 我们现在没货了。

en: I will be with you right away.
zh: 我马上就来。

en: They are now sitting in conference on that question.
zh: 他们现在正在开会讨论这个问题。

en: Appear before us now.
zh: 现在出现在我们面前。

en: The line is engaged.
zh: 线路占线。

en: I'm home, Mom!
zh: 我回来了，妈！

en: He came only as a witness to the light.
zh: 他来只是为了给光作见证。

en: I just wish we could leave this horrible place.
zh: 我只是希望我们能离开这个可怕的地方。

en: He who is afraid of asking is ashamed of learning.
zh: 不敢请教的人，羞于求知。

en: I think it's worth asking.
zh: 我认为值得问一下。

en: I don't want to be made a cat's paw.
zh: 我不想被人当枪使。

en: I think that it was probably Friday of last week.
zh: 我想那大概是上周的星期五。

en: She is not pretty, to be sure, but she is very clever.
zh: 她肯定不算漂亮，但她非常聪明。

en: Indeed he is rich, but he is not reliable.
zh: 他的确很富有，但他不可靠。

en: It's true that there are fewer children due to the falling birthrate, and there are fewer children in the school, but that is all to the good.
zh: 由于出生率下降，孩子确实少了，学校里的孩子也少了，但这都是好事。

en: Flying a kite can be dangerous.
zh: 放风筝可能很危险。

en: The kite went upward.
zh: 风筝向上飞去。

en: The octopus is in the sea.
zh: 章鱼在海里。

en: The kite got caught in the tree.
zh: 风筝挂在树上了。

en: But I never had you.
zh: 但是我从来没有拥有过你。

en: But I have an appointment with my client tomorrow.
zh: 但是我明天和我的客户有个预约。

en: Takeshi promised to help me with my homework, but at the last minute he let me down.
zh: 武答应帮我做作业，但最后时刻他让我失望了。

en: Takeshi raised his hand to ask a question.
zh: 武举手提问。

en: Takeshi hopes to go to London to study English.
zh: 武希望去伦敦学习英语。

en: Takeshi keeps a diary in English.
zh: 武用英语写日记。

en: Takeshi is making great progress with math.
zh: 武的数学进步很大。

en: Takeo is quite a good fellow in his way.
zh: 健夫就他的方式而言，是个相当不错的人。

en: Takeshi carried on his hard work.
zh: 武坚持努力工作。

en: Takeo is engrossed in solving mathematical problems.
zh: 健夫全神贯注于解决数学问题。

en: Takuya told me to start at once.
zh: 拓也告诉我立刻开始。

en: Have you ever been to Hawaii, Takuya?
zh: 拓也，你去过夏威夷吗？

en: I will share with you in the cost of the taxi.
zh: 我会和你分摊出租车费。

en: It'll be quicker to walk than to take a taxi.
zh: 走路比打车更快。

en: It's faster to reserve a taxi.
zh: 预订出租车更快。

en: I had a little difficulty in getting a taxi.
zh: 我打出租车有点困难。

en: I had trouble getting a taxi.
zh: 我很难打到出租车。

en: I held up my hand to stop a taxi.
zh: 我举起手拦出租车。

en: It will cost at least 2000 yen to take a taxi.
zh: 打车至少要花2000日元。

en: Before we get out of the taxi, we pay the fare.
zh: 在我们下出租车之前，我们支付车费。

en: Let's get out of the taxi.
zh: 我们下出租车吧。

en: Could you please get me a taxi?
zh: 请你帮我叫辆出租车好吗？

en: Will you please call me a taxi?
zh: 请你帮我叫辆出租车好吗？

en: Would you like me to get you a cab?
zh: 要我帮你叫辆出租车吗？

en: I'll call you a taxi.
zh: 我会帮你叫辆出租车的。

en: Would you like me to call a taxi?
zh: 要我帮你叫出租车吗？

en: The taxi picked up two passengers.
zh: 出租车接了两位乘客。

en: The taxi stopped dead at the traffic signal.
zh: 出租车在交通信号灯前突然停了下来。

en: What time does the cab leave for the airport?
zh: 去机场的出租车几点出发？

en: The taxi seemed to go as slowly as a snail.
zh: 出租车开起来像蜗牛一样慢。

en: No taxi stopped.
zh: 没有出租车停下来。

en: It was careless of you to leave your camera in the taxi.
zh: 你把相机落在出租车上真是太粗心了。

en: If there weren't so many taxis, there would be fewer traffic accidents.
zh: 如果出租车没那么多，交通事故就会少一些。

en: If you want the taxi driver to have a tip, hand him too much money and say, "Keep the change."
zh: 如果你想给司机小费，就多给他一些钱，然后说，“不用找了”。

en: Yesterday night, I shared a cab with Paris Hilton.
zh: 昨天晚上，我和帕丽斯·希尔顿拼了一辆出租车。

en: Let's take a taxi.
zh: 我们打出租车吧。

en: Why don't we take a taxi?
zh: 我们为什么不打出租车呢？

en: Taking a taxi is a luxury for me.
zh: 对我来说，打出租车是一种奢侈。

en: Shall we take a taxi?
zh: 我们打出租车好吗？

en: It was careless of you to leave your umbrella in the taxi.
zh: 你把伞落在出租车上真是太粗心了。

en: I left my umbrella in the cab.
zh: 我把伞落在出租车里了。

en: I would as soon walk as take a taxi.
zh: 我宁愿走路也不愿打出租车。

en: Which is quicker, a taxi or the subway?
zh: 出租车和地铁哪个更快？

en: Let's go by taxi, shall we?
zh: 我们打出租车去吧，好吗？

en: I would rather walk than go by taxi.
zh: 我宁愿走路也不愿打出租车。

en: I think you should go by taxi.
zh: 我认为你应该打出租车去。

en: You ought to go by taxi, or you might not get there in time.
zh: 你应该打出租车去，否则你可能赶不上时间。

en: It's more economical to go by bus instead of taking a taxi.
zh: 坐公共汽车比打出租车更经济。

en: The taxi has arrived.
zh: 出租车到了。

en: A taxi drew up at the main gate.
zh: 一辆出租车停在了大门口。

en: The taxi drew up to me.
zh: 出租车停在了我面前。

en: As our taxi broke down on the way, we had to walk to the station.
zh: 因为我们的出租车在路上抛锚了，我们不得不步行去车站。

en: The taxi is waiting outside.
zh: 出租车在外面等着。

en: Taxis stood in a rank in front of the station.
zh: 出租车在车站前排成一列。

en: If there are no taxis, we'll have to walk.
zh: 如果没有出租车，我们就得走路了。

en: There being no taxis available, we walked home.
zh: 因为没有出租车，我们走回了家。

en: As there was no taxi, I had to walk home.
zh: 因为没有出租车，我不得不走回家。

en: There being no taxis, I had to walk.
zh: 因为没有出租车，我不得不走路。

en: I want a lot.
zh: 我想要很多。

en: It is nice to have a lot of friends.
zh: 有很多朋友真好。

en: There are many books, aren't there?
zh: 有很多书，不是吗？

en: I've had enough, so my stomach is full.
zh: 我吃饱了，所以我的肚子很饱。

en: The more you have, the more you want.
zh: 你拥有的越多，你想要的就越多。

en: There were lots of bundles, but they weren't thousand-dollar bills.
zh: 有很多捆东西，但不是千元大钞。

en: You have made many mistakes.
zh: 你犯了很多错误。

en: Lots of famous people come here.
zh: 很多名人都来这里。

en: Many famous artists live in New York.
zh: 许多著名的艺术家住在纽约。

en: A host of friends came to see me off.
zh: 一大群朋友来为我送行。

en: A lot of trees were cut down.
zh: 很多树被砍倒了。

en: Many a book is published, but of them only a very few are worth reading.
zh: 出版的书很多，但其中只有极少数值得一读。

en: Though many books are published, hardly a few of them are of value.
zh: 虽然出版的书很多，但几乎没有几本有价值。

en: A lot of treasure was brought over to this country.
zh: 大量的宝藏被运到这个国家。

en: There used to be a pond here where you could see many swans.
zh: 这里曾经有一个池塘，你可以看到很多天鹅。

en: Many beautiful flowers bloom in spring.
zh: 春天盛开着许多美丽的花朵。

en: I saw a lot of birds flying toward the south.
zh: 我看到很多鸟飞向南方。

en: Many birds are on the branch.
zh: 许多鸟在树枝上。

en: A lot of insects are chirping in the field.
zh: 田野里有很多昆虫在鸣叫。

en: Many boats are sailing on the sea.
zh: 许多船在海上航行。

en: A lot of insects vanished overnight.
zh: 很多昆虫一夜之间消失了。

en: Many little red birds always sing merrily in the trees.
zh: 许多红色的小鸟总是在树上快乐地歌唱。

en: A lot of students look up to Mr Brown.
zh: 很多学生都很敬佩布朗先生。

en: Many stars are twinkling in the sky.
zh: 许多星星在天空中闪烁。

en: Much water is needed.
zh: 需要很多水。

en: A lot of people went by on the main street.
zh: 很多人从大街上经过。

en: A great many people were opposed to gene therapy in terms of ethics.
zh: 很多人在伦理方面反对基因疗法。

en: A bunch of people thrust their way toward the rear exit.
zh: 一群人奋力挤向后门。

en: Dozens of people encouraged me to fulfill my ambitions.
zh: 几十个人鼓励我实现我的抱负。

en: Plenty of people were waiting for the bus.
zh: 很多人在等公共汽车。

en: Many people were deceived by the advertisement.
zh: 很多人被这则广告欺骗了。

en: Lots of people took part in the marathon.
zh: 很多人参加了马拉松比赛。

en: A crowd of people were present at a party.
zh: 很多人参加了一个聚会。

en: A good many people have told me to take a holiday.
zh: 很多人都告诉我应该去度假。

en: Numbers of people came from all over the country.
zh: 很多人从全国各地赶来。

en: Many people were waiting in line.
zh: 很多人在排队等候。

en: A lot of people were waiting for him.
zh: 很多人在等他。

en: A lot of people were killed in World War II.
zh: 二战中很多人丧生。

en: A lot of people were killed in the war.
zh: 战争中很多人丧生。

en: A number of people die in traffic accidents.
zh: 很多人死于交通事故。

en: Quite a few people attended the opening ceremony of the new bridge.
zh: 相当多的人参加了新桥的开幕典礼。

en: Quite a few people went to the concert.
zh: 相当多的人去听了音乐会。

en: There are a lot of people walking there.
zh: 那里有很多人在走路。

en: A lot of boys ran after the rabbit.
zh: 很多男孩追着兔子跑。

en: Many boys and girls were present.
zh: 许多男孩和女孩都到场了。

en: A lot of boys are running in the park.
zh: 很多男孩在公园里跑步。

en: A lot of young people went to Hawaii this summer.
zh: 今年夏天很多年轻人去了夏威夷。

en: A lot of funds are necessary to travel.
zh: 旅行需要很多资金。

en: Many children were playing in the park.
zh: 许多孩子在公园里玩耍。

en: A lot of children gathered in the garden.
zh: 很多孩子聚集在花园里。

en: Lots of leftovers remained inside.
zh: 剩下很多剩菜。

en: There are many tall buildings.
zh: 有很多高楼大厦。

en: He saw something behind a lot of old boxes.
zh: 他在很多旧箱子后面看到了一些东西。

en: A lot of policemen guarded the hall.
zh: 很多警察守卫着大厅。

en: Dozens of students gathered there.
zh: 几十个学生聚集在那里。

en: A lot of fish perished.
zh: 很多鱼死了。

en: A lot of students do part-time jobs.
zh: 很多学生做兼职。

en: After running up so many flights of steps, she was completely out of breath.
zh: 跑了这么多层楼梯后，她完全喘不过气来。

en: Many paintings hang in the shop.
zh: 商店里挂着许多画。

en: A lot of houses were washed away by the flood.
zh: 很多房子被洪水冲走了。

en: Many yachts are in the harbor.
zh: 港口里有很多游艇。

en: Many European people are aware of environmental problems.
zh: 许多欧洲人意识到环境问题。

en: Many swallows will come soon from the south.
zh: 许多燕子很快就会从南方飞来。

en: A lot of birthday cards will arrive soon.
zh: 很快就会收到很多生日贺卡。

en: A lot of things happened and my schedule was messed up.
zh: 发生了很多事情，我的日程安排被打乱了。

en: Much money is spent every day.
zh: 每天都要花很多钱。

en: Although he had many toys, his greed made him want more.
zh: 虽然他有很多玩具，但他的贪婪让他想要更多。

en: Many dogs are alive.
zh: 很多狗都活着。

en: As a matter of fact, all great discoverers have been regarded as dreamers.
zh: 事实上，所有伟大的发现者都被认为是梦想家。

en: Yet today only about 15 percent of American families follow this pattern.
zh: 然而今天只有大约15%的美国家庭遵循这种模式。

en: But now, nothing is left for me.
zh: 但是现在，什么也没给我留下。

en: You are wrong, however.
zh: 然而，你是错的。

en: But for you I'll always be insignificant.
zh: 但是对你来说，我永远都是微不足道的。

en: So it is essential that you take the attitude of looking up yourself the information you feel necessary.
zh: 所以你必须采取一种态度，自己去查找你觉得必要的信息。

en: So he went in.
zh: 所以他进去了。

en: So there is a magnetic field around earth.
zh: 所以地球周围有一个磁场。

en: Who do you think will be chosen?
zh: 你认为谁会被选中？

en: That's why I told you not to go by car.
zh: 这就是我告诉你不要开车去的原因。

en: So I put the book away.
zh: 所以我把书收起来了。

en: So I will see him running on the way to school today.
zh: 所以今天我会在上学的路上看到他跑步。

en: I tried to tell you.
zh: 我试着告诉你。

en: So we'd better stay home.
zh: 所以我们最好待在家里。

en: So fuckin' what.
zh: 那又怎样。

en: So I'll get you something to eat.
zh: 所以我给你弄点吃的。

en: So what? It doesn't matter to me.
zh: 那又怎样？这对我来说无关紧要。

en: So I can make music.
zh: 所以我可以创作音乐。

en: That's why I told you not to go by yourself.
zh: 这就是我告诉你不要自己去的原因。

en: Now stop crying.
zh: 现在别哭了。

en: So they ought to have arrived here by now.
zh: 所以他们现在应该已经到达这里了。

en: Pigeons can find their way home with the help of the Earth's magnetic field.
zh: 鸽子可以在地球磁场的帮助下找到回家的路。

en: So the pigeon can feel the magnetic field on its head, but it can't feel the Earth's magnetic field.
zh: 所以鸽子可以感觉到头上的磁场，但它感觉不到地球的磁场。

en: Not that I have any objection.
zh: 我倒没什么意见。

en: So I ran to my father's restaurant.
zh: 所以我跑到我父亲的餐馆。

en: So, it isn't hot at all.
zh: 所以，一点都不热。

en: So nobody bothered about me.
zh: 所以没人理我。

en: So, players were often seriously injured and sometimes even killed in these rough games.
zh: 所以，在这些粗暴的比赛中，球员经常受重伤，有时甚至丧命。

en: However, my father used to fool around with women a lot.
zh: 然而，我父亲过去经常和女人鬼混。

en: The hawk circled round in the sky.
zh: 老鹰在天空中盘旋。

en: But "experiment" is not the appropriate word.
zh: 但是“实验”这个词并不恰当。

en: However, as living standards gradually came to rise, more and more people began to have their own bathrooms at home.
zh: 然而，随着生活水平的逐渐提高，越来越多的人开始在家里拥有自己的浴室。

en: But, she has never offered much excitement in the bedroom.
zh: 但是，她在卧室里从来没有提供过多少刺激。

en: But Bill interrupted the story saying: "Banana".
zh: 但是比尔打断了这个故事，说：“香蕉”。

en: But you have saved the best till now.
zh: 但是你把最好的留到了现在。

en: And yet, in the "real adult world" there are a lot of competitions.
zh: 然而，在“真正的成人世界”里，有很多竞争。

en: The towel counted for nothing.
zh: 毛巾毫无价值。

en: Shake off the towels.
zh: 甩掉毛巾。

en: Dry your face with a towel.
zh: 用毛巾擦脸。

en: The delicate, graceful flowers are in bloom.
zh: 娇嫩优雅的花朵正在盛开。

en: I rediscovered the importance of constant efforts.
zh: 我重新发现了持续努力的重要性。

en: The Dow Jones average posted a gain of two points today.
zh: 道琼斯指数今天上涨了两个点。

en: The Dow plunged 35 points and then bottomed out.
zh: 道琼斯指数暴跌35点，然后触底反弹。

en: What number is the downtown train?
zh: 去市中心的火车是几路车？

en: Where is the bus stop for downtown?
zh: 去市中心的公共汽车站在哪里？

en: Traffic downtown is all backed up.
zh: 市中心的交通都堵塞了。

en: There are many hotels downtown.
zh: 市中心有很多酒店。

en: The word downtown refers to the business quarter of any town.
zh: 市中心这个词指的是任何城镇的商业区。

en: How about Thai food?
zh: 吃泰国菜怎么样？

en: We could meet downtown. Would that be convenient for you?
zh: 我们可以去市中心见面。您觉得方便吗？

en: The data collected in Tyrel's research is of great value both to administrators and to educators.
zh: 在泰瑞尔的研究中收集的数据对管理者和教育者都具有重要价值。

en: Direct marketing is a means of allowing people to shop from home.
zh: 直销是一种让人们在家购物的方式。

en: I have to change tires.
zh: 我得换轮胎。

en: Can I dial directly?
zh: 我可以直拨吗？

en: You don't see many dial phones around anymore.
zh: 现在已经很少见到拨号电话了。

en: Nothing is as hard as a diamond.
zh: 没有什么比钻石更坚硬的了。

en: Diamond is essentially hard.
zh: 钻石本质上是坚硬的。

en: Diamonds are a girl's best friends.
zh: 钻石是女孩最好的朋友。

en: The hardness of diamond is such that it can cut glass.
zh: 钻石的硬度使得它可以切割玻璃。

en: The hardness of diamond is 10.
zh: 钻石的硬度是10。

en: The diamond shone brightly.
zh: 钻石闪闪发光。

en: Tires wear down because of friction between the rubber and the road surface.
zh: 轮胎会磨损是因为橡胶和路面之间的摩擦。

en: I'm not wearing a diamond ring, but I'm happy.
zh: 我没有戴钻石戒指，但我很开心。

en: We found a nail stuck in the tire.
zh: 我们发现一个钉子扎在轮胎里。

en: Could you check the tire pressure?
zh: 你能检查一下轮胎气压吗？

en: If you pump air into a tire it expands.
zh: 如果你往轮胎里打气，它会膨胀。

en: I pumped up the tire.
zh: 我给轮胎打了气。

en: I must put some air in the tire.
zh: 我必须给轮胎充点气。

en: Fill the tires with air.
zh: 给轮胎充气。

en: The timetable was disrupted.
zh: 时间表被打乱了。

en: The tire leaks air.
zh: 轮胎漏气。

en: I had to push my bicycle because I had a flat tire.
zh: 我不得不推着自行车，因为我的轮胎没气了。

en: I got a flat tire.
zh: 我的轮胎没气了。

en: Have you read the article about Asia in Time?
zh: 你看过《时代》杂志上关于亚洲的文章了吗？

en: Let's take time out to elaborate a strategy.
zh: 我们花点时间详细制定一个策略。

en: Imagine that you have a time machine.
zh: 想象一下你有一台时间机器。

en: Could you bring me a Time magazine?
zh: 你能给我带一本《时代》杂志吗？

en: Do you have Time magazine?
zh: 你有《时代》杂志吗？

en: I'll punch the clock.
zh: 我要打卡上班了。

en: It has become very warm.
zh: 天气变得很暖和了。

en: It's a very good newspaper, isn't it?
zh: 这是一份非常好的报纸，不是吗？

en: There were so many people.
zh: 当时有很多人。

en: It was a very, very hot night.
zh: 那是一个非常非常炎热的夜晚。

en: To our great annoyance, he barged in on our party.
zh: 让我们非常恼火的是，他闯入了我们的派对。

en: Although it is a very difficult task, I will do my best.
zh: 虽然这是一项非常困难的任务，但我会尽力而为。

en: It was a very cold winter.
zh: 那是一个非常寒冷的冬天。

en: Much to my surprise, my song appealed to many young people.
zh: 令我非常惊讶的是，我的歌吸引了很多年轻人。

en: I am sorry that I have troubled you so much.
zh: 很抱歉给您添了这么多麻烦。

en: "Thank you very much", she said with a smile.
zh: “非常感谢”，她笑着说。

en: It is getting rather late. I think I must be going now.
zh: 时间不早了。我想我该走了。

en: The pain has mostly gone away.
zh: 疼痛大部分都消失了。

en: It has become quite autumnal.
zh: 天气变得很有秋天的感觉了。

en: Can I use your typewriter?
zh: 我可以用你的打字机吗？

en: You can type, can't you?
zh: 你会打字，是吗？

en: The typist tried to erase the error.
zh: 打字员试图擦掉错误。

en: She got a job as a typist.
zh: 她找到了一份打字员的工作。

en: The divers found a wreck on the sea-bed.
zh: 潜水员在海底发现了一艘沉船。

en: Do you have any other guidebooks about Thailand?
zh: 你还有其他关于泰国的指南吗？

en: The dynamite went off with a bang.
zh: 炸药砰的一声爆炸了。

en: In Thailand, people use coconuts for food, drink and toys.
zh: 在泰国，人们用椰子做食物、饮料和玩具。

en: In Thailand it has already become too dry to grow rice in some parts of the country.
zh: 在泰国，该国部分地区已经变得太干燥，无法种植水稻。

en: In Thailand, bringing up the children isn't the father's responsibility; it's entirely up to the mother.
zh: 在泰国，抚养孩子不是父亲的责任；完全取决于母亲。

en: I usually walk.
zh: 我通常走路。

en: I usually have a glass of milk for breakfast.
zh: 我早餐通常喝一杯牛奶。

en: I usually get up late.
zh: 我通常起得很晚。

en: As a rule, I go to school before eight o'clock.
zh: 一般来说，我八点之前去学校。

en: We usually go out for drinking parties.
zh: 我们经常出去喝酒聚会。

en: I usually ride my bike to school. I mean to the office.
zh: 我通常骑自行车去学校。我是说去办公室。

en: Most workers get an automatic pay raise every year.
zh: 大多数工人每年都会自动加薪。

en: I get most things at the stores.
zh: 我大部分东西都在商店买。

en: The clinical records in most hospitals are kept in alphabetical order.
zh: 大多数医院的临床记录都按字母顺序排列。

en: Most developing countries are suffering from overpopulation.
zh: 大多数发展中国家都面临着人口过剩的问题。

en: Most Japanese live on rice.
zh: 大多数日本人以米饭为主食。

en: Most Japanese drink water from the tap.
zh: 大多数日本人喝自来水。

en: Don't you think most Japanese students work hard?
zh: 你不觉得大多数日本学生都很努力吗？

en: Most Japanese temples are made of wood.
zh: 大多数日本寺庙都是木制的。

en: Most birds can see only by day.
zh: 大多数鸟类只能在白天看到东西。

en: Most boys take after their fathers.
zh: 大多数男孩都像他们的父亲。

en: Most people live in pursuit of happiness.
zh: 大多数人都在追求幸福。

en: People feel most at ease when they are at home.
zh: 人们在家时感觉最自在。

en: Most people like to see in pictures what they would like to see in reality.
zh: 大多数人喜欢在图片中看到他们希望在现实中看到的东西。

en: I think most people are better off now than they used to be.
zh: 我认为现在大多数人的生活比过去好。

en: Most people like summer, but as for me, I like winter much better.
zh: 大多数人喜欢夏天，但就我而言，我更喜欢冬天。

en: Most people like watching TV.
zh: 大多数人喜欢看电视。

en: Most people retire at the age of sixty.
zh: 大多数人在六十岁退休。

en: Most people judge men only by their success or their good fortune.
zh: 大多数人只根据男人的成功或好运来评判他们。

en: The lives of most people are determined by their environment.
zh: 大多数人的生活是由他们的环境决定的。

en: Most people think so.
zh: 大多数人是这么认为的。

en: In most cases we had to give in to their demands.
zh: 在大多数情况下，我们不得不屈服于他们的要求。

en: Parents are usually concerned about their children's future.
zh: 父母通常关心孩子的未来。

en: Most boys know his name.
zh: 大多数男孩都知道他的名字。

en: Most women make much of fashion.
zh: 大多数女人都很讲究时尚。

en: Most women are not so young as they are painted.
zh: 大多数女人都没有她们描绘的那么年轻。

en: Most employees expect a pay raise once a year.
zh: 大多数员工期望每年加薪一次。

en: Most girls are kind.
zh: 大多数女孩都很善良。

en: Most work is not very pleasant.
zh: 大多数工作不是很愉快。

en: Most writers hate being criticized.
zh: 大多数作家讨厌被批评。

en: Women live longer than men in most countries.
zh: 在大多数国家，女性比男性活得更长。

en: Most whales feed on plankton.
zh: 大多数鲸鱼以浮游生物为食。

en: Most students study hard.
zh: 大多数学生努力学习。

en: Most students come to school on foot.
zh: 大多数学生步行上学。

en: Most students do the sights of Kyoto on their school excursion.
zh: 大多数学生在他们的学校旅行中参观京都的景点。

en: Most students like sports.
zh: 大多数学生喜欢运动。

en: Most students are doing preparation for the term examination.
zh: 大多数学生都在为期末考试做准备。

en: Most living creatures in the sea are affected by pollution.
zh: 海洋中大多数生物都受到污染的影响。

en: The British people in general are extremely fond of their pets.
zh: 一般来说，英国人非常喜欢他们的宠物。

en: Most Europeans cannot tell a Japanese from a Chinese.
zh: 大多数欧洲人无法区分日本人和中国人。

en: In most sports the team that practice hardest usually brings home the bacon.
zh: 在大多数运动中，练习最刻苦的队伍通常会赢得胜利。

en: Most Americans like hamburgers.
zh: 大多数美国人喜欢汉堡包。

en: Most people here have really hit the skids.
zh: 这里的大部分人都走下坡路了。

en: I usually gas up the car at this service station.
zh: 我通常在这个加油站给汽车加油。

en: More often than not, famine is accompanied by plague.
zh: 饥荒常常伴随着瘟疫。

en: In most cases, car accidents result from lack of sleep.
zh: 在大多数情况下，车祸是由于睡眠不足造成的。

en: More often than not, students prefer club activities to academic classes.
zh: 学生们通常更喜欢社团活动而不是学术课程。

en: The Titanic sunk on its maiden voyage.
zh: 泰坦尼克号在它的处女航中沉没了。

en: It was in 1912 that the Titanic sank during her first voyage.
zh: 泰坦尼克号于1912年在她的首次航行中沉没。

en: You're about right.
zh: 你说的差不多对。

en: On the whole I am satisfied with the result.
zh: 总的来说，我对结果感到满意。

en: About how much will it cost?
zh: 大概要多少钱？

en: About how long will it take?
zh: 大概要多久？

en: It's almost six o'clock.
zh: 快六点了。

en: I am sorry I have imposed so much on you.
zh: 很抱歉，我给你添了这么多麻烦。

en: She failed the examination and I was greatly disappointed.
zh: 她考试不及格，我非常失望。

en: We didn't have much trouble.
zh: 我们没有遇到太多麻烦。

en: They had not gone very far when they met an old man.
zh: 他们没走多远就遇到了一位老人。

en: We didn't have much fun.
zh: 我们玩得不是很开心。

en: That doesn't matter.
zh: 那没关系。

en: Hotshot!
zh: 真厉害！

en: It isn't much of a car.
zh: 这车不怎么样。

en: I'd like a daiquiri.
zh: 我想要一杯代基里酒。

en: In most cases, his answers are right.
zh: 在大多数情况下，他的答案都是正确的。

en: The Tigers lost the game, which was a surprise to us.
zh: 老虎队输了比赛，这让我们很惊讶。

en: There's little chance of keeping slim, unless you stick to a diet.
zh: 除非你坚持节食，否则几乎没有保持苗条的机会。

en: The chocolate cake tempted her even though she was dieting.
zh: 即使她在节食，巧克力蛋糕仍然诱惑着她。

en: Dieting takes up so much human endeavor with so little to show for it.
zh: 节食耗费了人类如此多的努力，却收效甚微。

en: How's your diet kick?
zh: 你的节食计划怎么样了？

en: She's lost a lot of weight since she went on a diet.
zh: 自从她开始节食以来，她瘦了很多。

en: Why don't you go on a diet?
zh: 你为什么不节食呢？

en: The diamond was set in a gold ring.
zh: 钻石镶嵌在金戒指上。

en: The tar won't come off. I'm going to have to take this skirt to the dry cleaner.
zh: 焦油弄不掉。我得把这条裙子送到干洗店去。

en: Go out of the terminal and turn right.
zh: 走出航站楼，然后向右转。

en: Please stay seated until we reach the terminal.
zh: 在我们到达航站楼之前，请保持坐姿。

en: Derby Day is Wednesday fortnight.
zh: 德比日是下下个星期三。

en: Mr Turner bade farewell to his colleagues.
zh: 特纳先生向他的同事们告别。

en: We buy eggs by the dozen.
zh: 我们按打买鸡蛋。

en: Turner stands out among the painters of his time.
zh: 特纳在他那个时代的画家中脱颖而出。

en: Darwin studied the animals and birds different from those he knew in England.
zh: 达尔文研究了那些与他在英国所知的不同的动物和鸟类。

en: Darwin wrote "the Origin of Species".
zh: 达尔文写了《物种起源》。

en: Have you studied Darwin's theory of evolution?
zh: 你研究过达尔文的进化论吗？

en: This revision of Darwin's ideas came under fire from academic positions.
zh: 对达尔文思想的这种修正受到了学术界的抨击。

en: We associate the name of Darwin with The Origin of Species.
zh: 我们将达尔文的名字与《物种起源》联系在一起。

en: Da Vinci could see farther than others.
zh: 达芬奇比其他人看得更远。

en: The Soviet troops started to withdraw from Afghanistan.
zh: 苏联军队开始从阿富汗撤军。

en: The USSR will only use air strikes in the country as a last resort.
zh: 苏联只有在万不得已的情况下才会对该国进行空袭。

en: The Soviet Union took a hostile attitude toward us.
zh: 苏联对我们采取了敌对态度。

en: I cannot help laughing to hear such a story.
zh: 听到这样的故事，我忍不住想笑。

en: I don't want to know that kind of story.
zh: 我不想知道那种故事。

en: You must be very naive to be taken in by such a story.
zh: 你一定很天真，才会相信这种故事。

en: He must be crazy to talk like that.
zh: 他那样说话一定是疯了。

en: Such a case is not uncommon today.
zh: 这样的情况在今天并不少见。

en: It is fortunate that you have such parents.
zh: 你有这样的父母真是幸运。

en: Don't keep company with such a selfish man.
zh: 不要和这么自私的人交往。

en: You ought not to sit up so late.
zh: 你不应该熬夜这么晚。

en: You shouldn't read such useless books.
zh: 你不应该读这么没用的书。

en: It is dangerous to drive so fast.
zh: 开车这么快很危险。

en: I have never heard of anyone by the name.
zh: 我从来没听说过叫这个名字的人。

en: Don't beat your head against a stone wall.
zh: 不要做无用功。

en: You don't have to obey such a law.
zh: 你不必遵守这样的法律。

en: Do not read such a book.
zh: 不要读这样的书。

en: I might as well die as lead such a life.
zh: 与其过这样的生活，我不如死了算了。

en: He will never get anywhere with that prejudiced idea.
zh: 他抱着那种偏见永远不会有出息。

en: That would bring only a small price.
zh: 那卖不了多少钱。

en: Don't tell me off like that.
zh: 不要那样训斥我。

en: To behave like that, he must be out of his mind.
zh: 他那样做，一定是疯了。

en: Let's not think like that.
zh: 我们不要那样想。

en: Don't talk back to me like that.
zh: 不要那样顶撞我。

en: That would be twenty-seven words instead of four, and while the bare message of the longer statement would be understood, the persuasive force would be lost.
zh: 那样会用二十七个字而不是四个字，虽然较长陈述的基本信息会被理解，但说服力会丧失。

en: It is stupid of him to behave like that.
zh: 他那样做真是愚蠢。

en: That's how I came to know her.
zh: 我是那样认识她的。

en: Don't talk like that.
zh: 不要那样说话。

en: Don't repeat such a careless mistake.
zh: 不要再犯这么粗心的错误。

en: Don't make such careless mistakes.
zh: 不要犯这么粗心的错误。

en: Such a strange thing is not likely to happen.
zh: 这样奇怪的事情不太可能发生。

en: I've never seen such a beautiful flower.
zh: 我从来没见过这么漂亮的花。

en: Don't give me such a sad look.
zh: 别用这么悲伤的眼神看着我。

en: Such words are so typical for him.
zh: 这样的话太符合他的风格了。

en: You'll catch cold in such thin clothing.
zh: 穿这么薄的衣服会着凉的。

en: They must be crazy to believe such nonsense.
zh: 他们一定是疯了才会相信这种胡说八道。

en: It is no use arguing with such a foolish man.
zh: 和这么愚蠢的人争论是没有用的。

en: How can you say such a foolish thing?
zh: 你怎么能说出这么愚蠢的话？

en: That's impossible.
zh: 那是不可能的。

en: I would not have said such a nonsense.
zh: 我不会说这种无稽之谈。

en: You can't fool me with your honeyed words.
zh: 你休想用花言巧语来骗我。

en: It is clever of her to solve such a difficult problem.
zh: 她能解决这么难的问题，真是聪明。

en: Don't ask such hard questions.
zh: 别问这么难的问题。

en: Don't ask me such a hard question.
zh: 别问我这么难的问题。

en: You can't fight a good fight with such a defeatist attitude.
zh: 用这么消极的态度是打不好胜仗的。

en: I didn't know you were that kind of a person.
zh: 我不知道你是那样的人。

en: That's the damnedest story I ever heard.
zh: 那是我听过的最离奇的故事。

en: Such a proposal would only be turned down immediately.
zh: 这样的提议只会立刻被拒绝。

en: You don't have to wince like that. I'll fix it so it doesn't hurt.
zh: 你不用那样龇牙咧嘴的。我会把它弄好，让它不疼。

en: If you go on at that rate, you will surely fail.
zh: 如果你继续这样下去，肯定会失败的。

en: I have no time to listen to such everyday affairs.
zh: 我没时间听这些鸡毛蒜皮的小事。

en: Don't keep company with such a man.
zh: 不要和这样的人交往。

en: I can't finish the job in so short a time.
zh: 我不可能在这么短的时间内完成这项工作。

en: How careless you are to forget such an important thing!
zh: 你竟然忘记这么重要的事，真是太粗心了！

en: You should not speak so loud.
zh: 你不应该这么大声说话。

en: Don't talk so loud.
zh: 别这么大声说话。

en: I'm concerned whether or not I can handle a big job like that.
zh: 我担心自己是否能胜任这么大的工作。

en: I cannot afford to pay so much.
zh: 我付不起这么多钱。

en: I've never seen so big a dog.
zh: 我从没见过这么大的狗。

en: Now, quit being so blasé about this.
zh: 现在，别再对这件事这么满不在乎了。

en: There can be no joy in that idle life.
zh: 那种游手好闲的生活不会有任何乐趣。

en: You don't have to stand on ceremony with me.
zh: 你不用和我这么客气。

en: Please don't walk so fast. I can't keep pace with you.
zh: 请不要走这么快。我跟不上你。

en: We have no such example.
zh: 我们没有这样的例子。

en: People would sell their souls to hear the concert from those seats.
zh: 人们会为了在那些座位上听音乐会而不惜出卖灵魂。

en: I can't imagine such a life.
zh: 我无法想象那样的生活。

en: I might as well die as marry such a man.
zh: 我与其嫁给那样的人，不如死了算了。

en: Nobody can get along with such a person.
zh: 没有人能和那样的人相处。

en: You should not keep company with such people.
zh: 你不应该和那样的人交往。

en: You must not behave so.
zh: 你一定不能这样表现。

en: Such a judge may as well retire from his job.
zh: 这样的法官还不如退休算了。

en: I couldn't bear to see such a scene.
zh: 我不忍心看到那样的场景。

en: You ought not to go to such a place.
zh: 你不应该去那种地方。

en: A bookstore in that location wouldn't make enough money to survive.
zh: 在那里的书店赚不到足够的钱来生存。

en: She was the last person I expected to see in such a place.
zh: 我最想不到会在那种地方见到她。

en: Don't worry about such a trifle thing.
zh: 不要为这种小事烦恼。

en: It isn't worthwhile going there.
zh: 去那里不值得。

en: You don't have to go getting so hairy about such a small thing.
zh: 你没必要为这么小的事情如此激动。

en: I hadn't bargained on such a heavy traffic jam.
zh: 我没想到会遇到这么严重的交通堵塞。

en: Don't trifle with such serious matters.
zh: 不要玩弄如此严肃的事情。

en: I would as soon stay where I am as go to such a place.
zh: 我宁愿待在我现在的地方，也不愿去那种地方。

en: You can't fool me with a trick like that.
zh: 你不能用那样的伎俩来愚弄我。

en: I wouldn't let a goof-up like that get to you. People have short memories and the one good thing about gossip is that it's short-lived.
zh: 我不会让那样的小失误影响到你。人们的记忆很短暂，而且八卦的好处就是它不会持续太久。

en: You don't have to tell me that, fool.
zh: 不用你告诉我，笨蛋。

en: Sleep off the problem.
zh: 睡一觉，把问题抛到脑后。

en: Such incidents are quite common.
zh: 这种事很常见。

en: I didn't expect that to come from you.
zh: 我没想到你会说出这样的话。

en: Pardon me for saying so.
zh: 请原谅我这么说。

en: It is bold of you to say such a thing.
zh: 你敢说这样的话，真是大胆。

en: It's thoughtless of her to say so.
zh: 她说这样的话，真是不经过大脑。

en: He must be crazy to say such a thing.
zh: 他一定是疯了才会说这样的话。

en: It is foolish of you to say such a thing.
zh: 你说这样的话，真是愚蠢。

en: You must be out of your mind to say that.
zh: 你一定是疯了才会说那种话。

en: She must be a fool to say so.
zh: 她一定是傻瓜才会这么说。

en: It is typical of him to say such a thing.
zh: 他说出这种话，很符合他的性格。

en: It's very rude of you to say a thing like that.
zh: 你说这样的话，非常无礼。

en: You will be taken for an ill-mannered person if you do so.
zh: 如果你这样做，会被认为是一个没有礼貌的人。

en: You must be a fool to do such a thing.
zh: 你一定是傻瓜才会做这种事。

en: It was careless of me to do something like that.
zh: 我真粗心，竟然做了那样的事。

en: He is wise enough not to do such a thing.
zh: 他很聪明，不会做那样的事。

en: The mother told her daughter to do it herself.
zh: 妈妈让女儿自己做。

en: Forget about that right now.
zh: 现在别想那个了。

en: Oh, don't worry about that.
zh: 哦，别担心那个。

en: For him, that will be like taking candy from a baby.
zh: 对他来说，那就像从婴儿手里抢糖一样容易。

en: I thought as much.
zh: 我早就这么想了。

en: You know I can't.
zh: 你知道我做不到。

en: There is no advantage in doing that.
zh: 这样做没有任何好处。

en: Don't be too hard on me.
zh: 别对我太苛刻了。

en: Such a childish plan is bound to fail.
zh: 这么幼稚的计划注定要失败。

en: How did you come by such a job?
zh: 你从哪里得到这样一份工作？

en: I never thought he was capable of doing something so cruel.
zh: 我从没想过他会做出如此残忍的事情。

en: It is foolish to read such a magazine.
zh: 读这种杂志是很愚蠢的。

en: You may as well take a nap as read such a magazine.
zh: 你还不如睡个午觉，别读这种杂志了。

en: Such a trivial thing is out of the question.
zh: 这么微不足道的事情是不可能的。

en: There's no sense acting all triumphant like a conquering hero over such a minor thing.
zh: 为这么一点小事就得意洋洋，像个凯旋的英雄，真是没意思。

en: I can't buy a book this expensive.
zh: 我买不起这么贵的书。

en: I would buy it, except that it costs too much.
zh: 我会买的，只是太贵了。

en: You need not have bought such an expensive book.
zh: 你本不必买这么贵的书。

en: I can't afford to buy such an expensive car.
zh: 我买不起这么贵的车。

en: Buying such an expensive car is out of the question.
zh: 买这么贵的车是不可能的。

en: Such a behavior gives rise to problem.
zh: 这样的行为会引起问题。

en: Give up such ideas.
zh: 放弃这种想法吧。

en: There is no excuse for such behavior.
zh: 这种行为是不可原谅的。

en: That idea never presented itself to me.
zh: 我从来没有想到过这个主意。

en: It is not proper that you talk that way.
zh: 你那样说话是不合适的。

en: We have seldom seen such a sight!
zh: 我们很少见到这样的景象！

en: It is stupid of you to make such a mistake.
zh: 你犯这种错误真是太蠢了。

en: She was stupid to make such a mistake.
zh: 她犯这种错误真是太蠢了。

en: There are few, if any, such mistakes.
zh: 即使有，这样的错误也极少。

en: You can't believe a word of it.
zh: 你一个字都不能相信。

en: Such an old fan would be next to useless.
zh: 这么旧的电风扇几乎没用了。

en: Like is hardly the word.
zh: 喜欢根本不足以形容。

en: That excuse will not do.
zh: 这个借口行不通。

en: Don't put it that way.
zh: 别那么说。

en: You're making yourself appear cheap.
zh: 你这样显得很掉价。

en: We shall never agree on such a careless plan.
zh: 我们永远不会同意这么草率的计划。

en: Put the plan on the scrap heap.
zh: 把这个计划扔进废纸堆吧。

zh: 根本不是。他吃得像只山羊一样。

en: I don't want to get involved in that sort of thing.
zh: 我不想卷入那种事情。

en: I don't want to get involved in that business.
zh: 我不想卷入那件事。

en: So, I don't know what to do next spring.
zh: 所以，我不知道明年春天该做什么。

en: You don't have to worry about a thing like that.
zh: 你不用担心那种事。

en: He is nothing less than a thief to do such a thing.
zh: 他做这种事简直就是个小偷。

en: Don't get excited about such a thing.
zh: 不要为这种事激动。

en: There is no time to quarrel over such a thing.
zh: 没有时间为这种事争吵。

en: What's the point?
zh: 有什么意义呢？

en: I was fool enough to do so.
zh: 我真傻，竟然会那样做。

en: I wouldn't dream of letting you do that.
zh: 我绝不会让你做那种事的。

en: I'll be damned if it's true.
zh: 如果那是真的，我简直不敢相信。

en: Do you think it likely?
zh: 你觉得这有可能吗？

en: That cannot be true.
zh: 那不可能是真的。

en: I will see that such a thing does not come to pass again.
zh: 我会确保这种事情不会再次发生。

en: It is up to you to see to it that such a thing doesn't happen.
zh: 你要负责确保这种事情不会发生。

en: He must be stupid not to see such a thing.
zh: 他一定很蠢，才会看不到这种事情。

en: Don't let that happen again!
zh: 别再让那种事发生了！

en: I do nothing of the kind.
zh: 我才不做那种事。

en: It's as easy as pie.
zh: 这太容易了。

en: If only I had a pretty dress like that!
zh: 要是我也有一件那么漂亮的裙子就好了！

en: People ask me 'why would you want to cherish a piece of junk like that?' But this little beauty means the world to me.
zh: 人们问我“你为什么要珍惜那样一件破烂？” 但这个小宝贝对我来说意义重大。

en: Nobody will believe that rumor.
zh: 没有人会相信那个谣言。

en: Stop inhaling your food. You should eat a little slower.
zh: 别狼吞虎咽的。你应该吃慢一点。

en: I don't know how such a rumor got about.
zh: 我不知道这样的谣言是怎么传开的。

en: Don't degrade yourself by telling such a lie.
zh: 不要说谎，贬低自己。

en: Happy were the students who had such a good teacher.
zh: 有这样一位好老师的学生真幸福。

en: My artisan pride cannot tolerate such sloppiness.
zh: 我的工匠自尊无法容忍如此的马虎。

en: I cannot accept an excuse like that.
zh: 我不能接受这样的借口。

en: How did you hit upon such an idea?
zh: 你怎么会想到这样的主意？

en: It's time to get down to business.
zh: 是时候开始认真工作了。

en: It's about time for dinner.
zh: 差不多该吃晚饭了。

en: It's about time we went back.
zh: 我们差不多该回去了。

en: It is time you get down to work.
zh: 你该开始工作了。

en: It is high time we said good-bye.
zh: 我们早该说再见了。

en: It is time you told her the truth.
zh: 你该告诉她真相了。

en: It's about time for him to get here.
zh: 他差不多该到了。

en: It's almost time to go to bed.
zh: 差不多该睡觉了。

en: It's about time we went to bed.
zh: 我们早该睡觉了。

en: I think I have to begin working on my homework.
zh: 我想我得开始做作业了。

en: I'm afraid I have to go now.
zh: 恐怕我得走了。

en: It's about time.
zh: 是时候了。

en: I think I have to get moving with some work for the exams.
zh: 我想我得开始准备考试了。

en: We should start getting Christmas gifts for the children.
zh: 我们应该开始给孩子们买圣诞礼物了。

en: It's about time you sent the children to bed.
zh: 你早该让孩子们睡觉了。

en: Hadn't we better be going soon?
zh: 我们是不是该走了？

en: Let's be going now.
zh: 我们走吧。

en: I'm taking off now.
zh: 我先走了。

en: It's time you faced reality.
zh: 你该面对现实了。

en: It is about time you went to school.
zh: 你早该去上学了。

en: It's about time I was going home.
zh: 我早该回家了。

en: We'd better go home now.
zh: 我们最好现在回家。

en: Maybe it's about time I started learning to program.
zh: 也许我该开始学习编程了。

en: It's about time we brought this party to an end, isn't it?
zh: 我们是不是该结束这场派对了？

en: It's about time you set about cleaning the table.
zh: 你早该开始收拾桌子了。

en: I think it's time to wind up this meeting.
zh: 我想该结束这次会议了。

en: It's almost time for the guest to arrive.
zh: 客人差不多要到了。

en: It is time I left here.
zh: 我该离开这里了。

en: Pick it up.
zh: 捡起来。

en: It is about time I was going.
zh: 我早该走了。

en: Turn it off.
zh: 关掉它。

en: From that time on, they came to love each other.
zh: 从那时起，他们开始相爱。

en: They have never been heard of since.
zh: 从那以后就再也没有人听说过他们了。

en: Since then he had put his whole soul into his work.
zh: 从那以后，他把全部精力都投入到工作中。

en: He has led a loose life since then.
zh: 从那以后，他过着放荡的生活。

en: He has never been heard of since.
zh: 从那以后就再也没有人听说过他了。

en: We have never heard from him since.
zh: 从那以后我们就再也没有收到他的消息。

en: I have never heard from him since.
zh: 从那以后我就再也没有收到他的消息。

en: Our sphere of influence has expanded so much since then.
zh: 从那以后，我们的势力范围扩大了很多。

en: We have been friends ever since.
zh: 从那以后我们一直是朋友。

en: Have you been here since?
zh: 你从那时起就一直在这里吗？

en: It has been very fine since then.
zh: 从那以后天气一直很好。

en: Three years have passed since then.
zh: 从那以后已经过去三年了。

en: Since then she couldn't look up to her mother.
zh: 从那以后，她再也无法尊敬她的母亲了。

en: He has not been heard of since.
zh: 从那以后就再也没有人听说过他了。

en: I had never seen a more beautiful sight.
zh: 我从未见过如此美丽的景象。

en: Have you any further questions?
zh: 你还有其他问题吗？

en: You can't expect more than that.
zh: 你不能期望更多了。

en: Beyond that I cannot help you.
zh: 除此之外，我无法帮助你。

en: I couldn't bear any more insults.
zh: 我再也无法忍受更多的侮辱了。

en: You won't find a better job in a hurry.
zh: 你不会很快找到更好的工作。

en: He led a hard life after that.
zh: 在那之后，他过着艰苦的生活。

en: I haven't seen her since then.
zh: 从那以后我就没见过她了。

en: I cannot take less.
zh: 我不能少要。

en: It is far from easy to understand it.
zh: 要理解它绝非易事。

en: We need some clues to understand it.
zh: 我们需要一些线索才能理解它。

en: To understand it, you have only to read this book.
zh: 要理解它，你只需要读这本书。

en: It's the animal in me that wants it.
zh: 是我的兽性想要它。

en: Let it be done by six this evening.
zh: 让它在今晚六点前完成。

en: Send it by mail.
zh: 用邮件寄送。

en: Will you send it by mail?
zh: 你用邮件寄送吗？

en: Please bring it back tomorrow.
zh: 请明天把它带回来。

en: It was careless of her to forget it.
zh: 她忘记这件事真是粗心大意。

en: Just wrap it up.
zh: 把它包起来就行了。

en: Let's get it over with.
zh: 我们快点结束它吧。

en: Let me hear it.
zh: 说给我听听。

en: I am sad to hear it.
zh: 听到这个消息我很伤心。

en: It made my blood boil to hear that.
zh: 听到那个消息我怒火中烧。

en: When she heard that, she turned pale.
zh: 当她听到那个消息时，她脸色苍白。

en: As soon as he heard of it, he hastened to the spot.
zh: 他一听到这件事，就赶紧赶到现场。

en: She felt like crying upon hearing that.
zh: 听到那个消息，她想哭。

en: I'm very sorry to hear that.
zh: 听到这个消息我非常难过。

en: I'm very glad to hear that.
zh: 听到这个消息我非常高兴。

en: I'm sorry to hear that.
zh: 听到这个消息我很抱歉。

en: I am indeed very glad to hear that.
zh: 听到这个消息我确实非常高兴。

en: My resolution was shaken when I heard about it.
zh: 当我听到这件事时，我的决心动摇了。

en: I'm sorry to hear it.
zh: 听到这个消息我很遗憾。

en: I sighed with relief to hear it.
zh: 听到这个消息我松了一口气。

en: I am very much relieved to know that.
zh: 得知这件事我非常放心。
